revised_title: High-Resolution Electron Energy Loss Spectroscopy: Applications and Advancements
tldr: This article discusses the advancements and applications of high-resolution electron energy loss spectroscopy (EELS) in studying surface chemistry and vibrational spectroscopy. EELS offers high sensitivity and a wide spectral range, allowing for the observation of more vibrational modes than optical methods. The article highlights various techniques and their limitations, as well as the importance of understanding coverage-dependent frequency shifts and dipole coupling for proper interpretation of transmission spectra from supported catalysts.
